intro: Onosma burmanica, commonly known as Burmese onosma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. It has a compact growth habit with upright stems and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices. Onosma burmanica is also valued for its ornamental appeal due to its vibrant floral display.
